Feb 13, 2014

Add bookmark

#1

I found about 49% of a hundred dollar bill. Assuming it is real bill, will a bank give me $100 or $50? If someone cut a bunch of bills in half, realistically the bank should only honor 50% of its value?

Feb 13, 2014

I belive you must possess more than 50% of a bill to get the value of it... So you'd get nothing...

That sucks!

More than 50% of a note identifiable as United States currency is present; or,

50% or less of a note identifiable as United States currency is present, and the method of mutilation and supporting evidence demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Treasury that the missing portions have been totally destroyed.

In Canada I think they give you half.

I thought the rule was that the bill had to show the full serial number on one half and part of it on the other to be considered "legal tender".

Half of a bill of any value in the U.S. hasn't been accepted anywhere, AFAIK, for a long time. I remember getting turned down at a 7-11 back in the 80s with half a $10 bill.
